block.p: When Illinois declared a moratorium on executions recently, after 13 condemned men were found innocent, some death-penalty supporters called the state an aberration. It isn't. A new study found that nationwide, two-thirds of death-penalty convictions over two decades were overturned on appeal, with 7 percent of the condemned later found not guilty. And, typically, the appeals process takes nine years.
